Ingredients.2: 2 cups warm water (110 degrees F (43 degrees C))

Directions.1: Dissolve yeast in warm water in a large bowl. Mix in 3 cups flour and salt. Stir in remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, beating well after each addition.

Directions.2: Turn dough out onto a lightly floured work surface. Knead until smooth, about 10 minutes. Place dough in a greased bowl; turn to coat with oil. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.

Directions.3: Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C).

Directions.4: Divide dough into 16 equal pieces and form into rounds. Roll into 1/4-inch-thick circles. Poke rounds with your fingers to create small indentations.

Directions.5: Mix za'atar and olive oil together in a small bowl. Spread over circles. Place on ungreased baking sheets.

Directions.6: Bake in the preheated oven until dough is golden brown, 5 to 6 minutes.
